question.title: Remove character
question.content:
For a given string(str) and a character X, write a function to remove all the occurrences of X from the given string and return it.

The input string will remain unchanged if the given character(X) doesn't exist in the input string.

Input Format:
The first line of input contains a string without any leading and trailing spaces.

The second line of input contains a character(X) without any leading and trailing spaces.
Output Format:
The only line of output prints the updated string.
Note:
You are not required to print anything explicitly. It has already been taken care of.
Constraints:
0 <= N <= 10^6
Where N is the length of the input string.

Time Limit: 1 second
Sample Input 1:
aabccbaa
a
Sample Output 1:
bccb
Sample Input 2:
xxyyzxx
y
Sample Output 2:
xxzxx

rephrased.body: Given a string 'input' and a character 'c', implement a function to create and return a new string by removing all occurrences of the character 'c' from the input string. If 'c' is not found in 'input', the original string should be returned.
constraints: 0 <= N <= 10^6, where N is the length of the input string.
The input string contains no leading or trailing spaces.
The character to be removed is a single character without leading or trailing spaces.

testcases.explanation: All occurrences of 'a' are removed from "aabccbaa" resulting in "bccb".
All occurrences of 'y' are removed from "xxyyzxx" resulting in "xxzxx".
Since 'h' is not present in "abcdefg", the string remains unchanged.
All characters in the string are 'a', so removing them results in an empty string.
All occurrences of 't' are removed from "teststring" resulting in "essring".
Removing a character from an empty string results in an empty string.
Removing spaces from "hello world" results in "helloworld"
